comment: ‘ʔənte’ is in fact the 2sgM form, the 2sgF form is ‘ʔənti’ (Cowell 1964:539).
‘ʔənte’ is in fact the 2sgM form, the 2sgF form is ‘ʔənti’ (Cowell 1964:539).
‘-ak’ is in fact the 2sgM form, the 2sgF form is ‘-ek’ (Cowell 1964:539). In addition, this form surfaces as ‘-k’ when suffixed to verb with a final vowel (Cowell 1964:540).

This form surfaces as ‘-∅’ when suffixed to a verb with a final vowel (Cowell 1964:540).
